TopicTitle: Kerbal Wars - X -wing vs. Tie fighter

Articles.Content:
Table of Star Wars replica craft

[TABLE]

[TR]

[TD]**Name**[/TD]

[TD]**Builder**[/TD]

[TD]**File**[/TD]

[TD]**Version**[/TD]

[TD]**Mods**[/TD]

[TD]**Images**[/TD]

[TD]**Notes**[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]X-Wing[/TD]

[TD]Vostok[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=164644&viewfull=1#post164644)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Front](http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/9263/screenshot75.png), [Back](http://img685.imageshack.us/img685/5910/screenshot77l.png)[/TD]

[TD]Easy to fly, looks amazing.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]TIE Interceptor[/TD]

[TD]Rich[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=164773&viewfull=1#post164773)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Front](http://img545.imageshack.us/img545/9784/screenshot14h.png), [Back](http://img254.imageshack.us/img254/3069/screenshot13p.png)[/TD]

[TD]Take off at 80m/s by pitching up, roll and pitch up to turn.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]Naboo Fighter[/TD]

[TD]GOOMH[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=164847&viewfull=1#post164847)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Top](http://i.imgur.com/bKbcn.png)[/TD]

[TD]Added tail fins to make it flyable in the atmosphere.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]Jedi Star Fighter (Delta-7 Aethersprite-class)[/TD]

[TD]Thobewill10[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=164979&viewfull=1#post164979)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Landed](http://i.imgur.com/BXAkO.png), [Front](http://i.imgur.com/0mj2d.png)[/TD]

[TD]Requires very fine controls, especially in low atmosphere[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]Y-Wing[/TD]

[TD]sal\_vager[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=165075&viewfull=1#post165075)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Above](http://i.imgur.com/028SE.jpg)[/TD]

[TD]Flies pretty well, use ASAS to take off, drifts to the side a little.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]Jedi Star Fighter (Eta-2 Actis-class)[/TD]

[TD]Vostok[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=164953&viewfull=1#post164953)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Landed](http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/6172/screenshot87f.png), [Front](http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/1887/screenshot90.png)[/TD]

[TD]You need to be a Jedi to fly this, uses RCS so make sure it is turned on and use the 'H' key for throttle.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]TIE Bomber[/TD]

[TD]Rich[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=165098&viewfull=1#post165098)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Front](http://img822.imageshack.us/img822/7615/screenshot23j.png), [Back](http://img17.imageshack.us/img17/3817/screenshot24a.png)[/TD]

[TD]Requires ASAS to take off, full throttle, gentle corrections on the runway to keep it in the centre, pull back at 155 m/s. You need to be Darth Vader to fly this without ASAS on.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]X-Wing[/TD]

[TD]Rich[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=164625&viewfull=1#post164625)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Landed](http://img4.imageshack.us/img4/4051/screenshot10rd.png), [Front](http://img225.imageshack.us/img225/2386/screenshot11h.png)[/TD]

[TD]Easy to fly and land.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]TIE Fighter[/TD]

[TD]Rich[/TD]

[TD][Post with .craft file](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10881-Kerbal-Wars-X-wing-vs-Tie-fighter?p=164625&viewfull=1#post164625)[/TD]

[TD]0.15[/TD]

[TD]Stock[/TD]

[TD][Landed](http://img651.imageshack.us/img651/8862/screenshot6g.png), [Front](http://img827.imageshack.us/img827/1826/screenshot8ng.png)[/TD]

[TD]Taking off is hard, but you can just fall off the runway. Handles like a washing machine.[/TD]

[/TR]

[/TABLE]

> ![screenshot75r.png](http://img824.imageshack.us/img824/6389/screenshot75r.png)

> ![screenshot22b.png](http://img145.imageshack.us/img145/3950/screenshot22b.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-30T13:15:15Z" title="08/30/2012 01:15  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 30, 2012</time> by Rich**
looks nice downloading now will post back with more feedback.
Were there any mods involved? How do you get onto the runway???

> 
> Were there any mods involved? How do you get onto the runway???

Using the Spaceplane Hangar takes care of that, unless these were assembled in the VAB for whatever reason.

Updated the OP with the version and construction information. The X-Wing isn\'t such a bad plane, but the Tie fighter is a pig to fly. That said, it is noted somewhere in Star Wars lore, that the X-wings have the edge in atmosphere combat.

> ![screenshot11h.png](http://img225.imageshack.us/img225/2386/screenshot11h.png)
> ![screenshot10rd.png](http://img4.imageshack.us/img4/4051/screenshot10rd.png)
> 
> ![screenshot8ng.png](http://img827.imageshack.us/img827/1826/screenshot8ng.png)
> 
> ![screenshot6g.png](http://img651.imageshack.us/img651/8862/screenshot6g.png)
> 
> 

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-30T12:37:09Z" title="08/30/2012 12:37  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 30, 2012</time> by Rich**

A CHALLENGER APPEARS

![WpHMR.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/WpHMR.jpg)

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Didn\'t see this topic when I posted my x-wing. I like the Tie fighter, looks awesome!

 My x-wing flies, and is moderately controllable. I even managed to land it!

> 
> ![screenshot75.png](http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/9263/screenshot75.png)
> 
> ![screenshot77l.png](http://img685.imageshack.us/img685/5910/screenshot77l.png)

> 
> Didn\'t see this topic when I posted my x-wing. I like the Tie fighter, looks awesome!
> 
>  My x-wing flies, and is moderately controllable. I even managed to land it!

That is amazing! I feel bad for not putting much effort into mine now ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif), would probably work better as an S-Wing if I pull the top two wings off. Do you mind if I add the craft to the OP; compiling a list of Star Wars craft? I am going to try and make some more of the Tie Fighter models later today.

No sure, go ahead ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I look forward to seeing the tie fighter! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Took a while but, here is my attempt at a TIE interceptor, doesn\'t fly too badly considering its shape. To take off, reach 80m/s and pull back.

> ![screenshot14h.png](http://img545.imageshack.us/img545/9784/screenshot14h.png)
> ![screenshot13p.png](http://img254.imageshack.us/img254/3069/screenshot13p.png)
> 
> 

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-30T12:40:53Z" title="08/30/2012 12:40  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 30, 2012</time> by Rich**
Looks awesome! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I was surprised by how well the Interceptor flies. Currently working on a TIE bomber, it flies, but it needs some more work to balance it out. Though I suspect it will be never be something you will want to take you kids to school in.

> ![screenshot19dz.png](http://img411.imageshack.us/img411/1917/screenshot19dz.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-30T12:44:49Z" title="08/30/2012 12:44  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 30, 2012</time> by Rich**

Does it have to be original saga craft only or can I post the Naboo fighter from the dreaded new saga? I have two versions one with a rudder and elevators and the flip happy no tail one.

EDIT: Updated Craft to look more like the N-1 Starfighter it\'s based off of.
If it is related to Star Wars and you can make it fly, then it is OK. I have added this to the table in the OP.
This looks fun. I\'ll have to give a craft a try

I made a jedi fighter, I think it\'s called that. It flies with RCS. Steering is pretty much optional.

![screenshot87f.png](http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/6172/screenshot87f.png)

![screenshot90.png](http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/1887/screenshot90.png)
Added to the OP. You need to be a Jedi to fly this. Let alone hang out of the window and take pictures.
It definitely wasn\'t flying stable when I took that picture! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I think about two seconds later it hit the floor.

Made a Delta-7 Jedi Starfighter

![0mj2d.png](http://i.imgur.com/0mj2d.png)

![BXAkO.png](http://i.imgur.com/BXAkO.png)

> [http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20090410213129/starwars/images/1/11/Jedistarfighter.jpg](http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20090410213129/starwars/images/1/11/Jedistarfighter.jpg)

> ![KEnCQ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/KEnCQ.jpg)
> ![OGDfk.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/OGDfk.jpg)
> 
> ![s5iXg.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/s5iXg.jpg)
> 
> ![1Aiop.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1Aiop.jpg)
> 
> ![g2BGu.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/g2BGu.jpg)
> 
> ![IWVXy.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/IWVXy.jpg)
> 
> 

It\'s very flyable, but requires very fine controls, especially in low atmosphere, as it tends to pitch upwards and roll to one side. Trim is very useful, as is the onboard RCS.

However, it makes a decent high-atmo glider.

Craft file attached

> 
> Made a Delta-7 Jedi Starfighter

Awesome, added it to the OP ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

How about a *Y-Wing* to add to the collection ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Y-Wings are supposed to be slow and clunky, this is slow but is twitchy to fly, use SAS to take off and then when you have some height you can trim it to fly pretty well, I didn\'t need SAS in the screenshot or for landing.

The wings overlap a lot so it\'ll drift to a random side, and it might handle a lot better on a more powerful PC, I got a lot of slowdown with it.

I\'ll try improving the flight characteristics another time, have fun ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![028SE.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/028SE.jpg)

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Nice Y-Wing, added it to the OP. I am hoping someone will try a B-Wing, otherwise I am going to have to go through the pain.

Completed my TIE bomber, requires ASAS to take off, full throttle, needs gentle corrections on the runway to keep it in the centre, pull back at 155 m/s. Flying this without ASAS, can only be done by Darth Vader.

> ![screenshot24a.png](http://img17.imageshack.us/img17/3817/screenshot24a.png)
> ![screenshot23j.png](http://img822.imageshack.us/img822/7615/screenshot23j.png)
> 
>

I always preferred the Empires craft over the Rebels, unshielded, light and fast ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

How can a B-Wing even be made without S-foils?

Little bit of Kerbal ingenuity gives the launch chassis, the next pictures are classified.
